title: Type ID Cold Case Files: January 2009
content:
Anyone up for an impromptu battle of Type ID skills?

I've been digging through our archives, and found these (gasp!) zero-response posts from January 2009 that never got solved. I'm teeing them up for you Type IDers who love a good mystery.

If you solve them, respond on the respective thread and let us know back here if you've closed it out. Can we get them all?

We'll track the results (who solved it, and how fast) and post a scoreboard here as they're solved. The timer starts as of this posting.

Ready.. Set.. Go!

// SANS  
 [anyone know the id of this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53219)  
 [Ronan Bennett - "Zugzwang" condensed gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53438) / SOLVED by Jan, Justin\_Ch  
 [Can you identify this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53797)  
 [Can anyone name this font or find something simliar?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/54024)  
 [Need help ID'ing this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/54207) / SOLVED by Rasmus Michaëlis

// SERIF  
 [BIRRA MORETTI](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53156) / SOLVED by Mike Yanega  
 [Help please, can you ID this font? thx](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/54147)

// DISPLAY  
 [any clues?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53135)  
 [looking desperatly for the name of this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53378)  
 [Two fonts for One Drop](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53633)  
 [Grunge font identification](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53775) / SOLVED by JL  
 [500 - Chunky font - any ideas?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53979)  
 [What font is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/54084)

// SCRIPT/HANDWRITTEN  
 [solutions font id](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53721) / SOLVED by himasf  
 [Can anyone identify this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53774)

// BLACKLETTER  
 [Book cover typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/54087)
author: Jared Benson

comments.content: Those are tough. I identified only one so far: [the grungy one under DISPLAY](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/typophile.com/node/53775)
The Ronan Bennett "Zungzwang" cover was solved for me by Jan in another thread back in April. I've just updated my thread although I probably should have done it back then.

Under // DISPLAY, 'any clues?'

Custom type from **[Spin](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122150/http:/www.spin.co.uk/)**. To find more of it, see 'Identity' section of their site and find the project 'PROA Building'.
